New Records: The Cavaliers extended their franchise-best winning streak to 15 games, becoming the fourth team in NBA history to begin a season 15-0.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored 25 points, Ty Jerome scored 24 points, Evan Mobley put up 23 points and 11 rebounds, and Jarrett Allen added 21 points and 15 rebounds to boost the Cavaliers' offense.
The Cavaliers held a 72-59 halftime lead, shooting 66.7% (26-for-39) from the field and securing only one offensive rebound in the half.
Post-Match Reflections: Only the Golden State Warriors (24-0 in 2015-16) have enjoyed a better start than the Cavaliers' 15-0 record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georges Niang contributed 13 points off the bench for the Cavaliers.
Others: The Cavaliers had a double-digit lead at 18-7 about 4:10 into the game.
